page.title: 08VILLAGE HALL
page.content:
THE VILLAGE HALL STANDS NEXT TO THE CHURCH AT GREAT FRANSHAM AND DURING THE 19TH CENTURY WAS THE VILLAGE SCHOOL. WHEN THIS WAS CLOSED THE CHURCH COUNCIL HANDED IT OVER TO THE VILLAGE TO USE AS A COMMUNITY HALL
A COMMITTEE OF 8 RAISE FUNDS FOR MAINTENANCE AND THE PROVISION OF A CARETAKER. IT IS USED REGULARLY BY THE WOMENS INSTITUTE AND THE GOLDEN HOUR AND FOR PRIVATE PARTIES, ELECTIONS, ETC.
THE YOUTH OPPORTUNITIES TRAINING SCHEME HAVE HAD A TEAM OF BOYS BUILDING A NEW CHIMNEY, DAMP-PROOFING AND REPLASTERING AND ROOF REPAIRS
EVENTS DURING THE YEAR: A FRANSHAM V DUNHAM VILLAGE QUIZ, A BAR-B-QUE AND HARVEST SUPPER.
